Cell.Data: Anything between straight brackets - i.e. [ ] - is a formatting tag. Do not change these tags and keep them in the same relative position in the text. Anything between curly brackets - i.e. { } - is a place where text or numbers will be inserted by the game. Do not change the tag, but feel free to change its position in the text to suit the localized text.

In the text below, text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.

In the text below, any inserted strings - anything of the form {text} - is replaced by an integer value for the thing described in the brackets. If the {text} is not followed by a unit - e.g. shields, hitpoints - the icon for the unit is inserted together with the integer. The same holds for symbols - e.g. '+', '%' - which are occasionally inserted together with the integer.
For references to game terminology and in-world references, please check the glossary delivered as part of the documentation.

By using a combination of blackmail and direct threats the Shakarn can intimidate their foes into profit.[br/][br/]Gain a {InfluenceDiscount}%[influence/] discount when dealing with NPC Factions. Faction War Quest rewards trigger at {NewNumberOfUnits} units defeated, instead of {StandardNumberOfUnits}.
Faction War Quests is a special mechanic that rewards players who do well when fighting against a NPC Faction.

The Shakarn’s homeworld is 90% oceanic, covered by atolls and archipelagos. Through promoting festivities next to bodies of water, the Shakarn colonists can reminisce about their homes and those they left behind.[br/][br/]Colonies gain +{FoodAmount}[supply/] and +{HappinessAmount}[happiness/] if the coastal or river feature is in their domain.
"An atoll, sometimes called a coral atoll, is a ring-shaped coral reef including a coral rim that encircles a lagoon partially or completely."

Your people are attuned to the rhythm of war and will be faster and more efficient when razing enemy colonies.[br/][br/]Resources gained from razing enemy colonies and sector bases is increased by {RazeBonus}% and it takes {TurnsSpeedUp}[turn/] less to raze.

By facilitating communication between active agents, intelligence travels faster.[br/][br/]Gain +{Strength}[operationstrength/] when using [abilityblue]Infiltrate Operations Center[/abilityblue][br/]Gain +{InfluenceAmount}[Influence/] and +{KnowledgeAmount}[Research/] per turn for each active infiltration on a unique player.

Increasing the presence of veteran Domok advisers helps you with military training and conscription, increasing the efficiency of all units and reducing their maintenance.[br/][br/]All units deal +{DamageIncrease}% damage, gain +{AccuracyIncrease}% accuracy, and have their [energy/] upkeep reduced by {ReductionPercentage}%.
This unit deals +{DamageIncrease}% damage and has +{AccuracyIncrease}% accuracy. In addition, its upkeep is reduced by {UpkeepDiscount}%.

Increasing the number of Zardas advisors helps you craft and maintain a holocrafted network of signals, allowing your agents to communicate through subtle holographic codes hidden in plain sight, while confounding your enemies.[br/][br/]Covert Operations cost {OpDiscount}% less to prime and you gain +{DefenseAmount}[operationDefense/] Operational Defense.[br/]Infiltrators now deal +{Damage}% damage, even when Holoshifted.
Remove target friendly unit's negative Status Effects and heal it for {HPAmount}[hp/]. This effect jumps to {OtherTargets} other units within {HexRange} hexes.

All friendly units in a {HExRad} hex radius gain a {EvasionAmount}% evasion and +{ShieldAmount}[Shield/] for {BuffDuration}[turn/]. All enemy Biological and Cyborg units in the area have a {DisorientedChance}[StrengthPhysical/] strength chance of getting [abilityred]Disoriented[/abilityred], gaining a {FumbleChance}% fumble chance for {DisorientedDuration}[turn/].

Target unit has a chance, based on how low its [hp/] is, of being transported into the orbital layer for research, killing the unit.[br/]Chance increases further if the unit is [abilityred]Concussed[/abilityred], [abilityred]Disorientated[/abilityred], [abilityred]Impaired[/abilityred],[br/][abilityred]Stunned[/abilityred], [abilityred]Sleeping[/abilityred] or [abilityred]Disabled[/abilityred].[br/]Gain {KnowledgeAmount}[research/] per tier of the abducted unit.

A Omni Flare deals {ThermalAmount}[damageThermal/] and {SoundAmount}[damagePhysical/] to units in a {HexRange} hex range. Has a {ImpairedChance}[strengthPhysical/] strength chance of applying [abilityred]Impaired[/abilityred], disabling unit mods and applying [abilityred]Slow[/abilityred] for {Duration}[turn/].

Spread disinformation through the media channels of target player, reducing their relation with all races by -{RaceReduction}[opinion0/] for {Duration}[turn/].[br/]On failure, applies -{RaceReductionFailure}[opinion0/] instead.
Our agents successfully infiltrated the enemy's news networks and social media, spreading false information undetected.
Our agents successfully infiltrated the enemy's news networks and social media, spreading false information, but the enemy identified and banned our accounts, and is now aware of our involvement.
Our agents didn't get the media traction they needed to damage the enemy's reputation. Luckily for us, the enemy couldn't identify our agents or track our accounts.

Our agents didn't get the media traction they needed to damage the enemy's reputation. Even worse, our influencers and news anchors were caught and broke under enemy interrogation, revealing our involvement.

Enemy agents infiltrated our news networks and social media, misdirecting and deceiving the populace, portraying our government as corrupt and immoral! Regardless of the accuracy of these attacks, we caught the agents and now know who is responsible, but our race relations have been reduced until we can clean our image.

We discovered enemy agents infiltrated on our social media, but our counterintelligence operatives caught them, blocked their accounts and identified the source of this attack. Unfortunately, the small amount of misinformation they spread still damaged race relations.

Enemy agents infiltrated our news networks and social media, misdirecting and deceiving the populace, portraying our government as corrupt and immoral! Truthful or not, our race relations have been reduced until we can clean our image.

We discovered enemy agents infiltrated on our social media, but our counterintelligence operatives were too late to stop them. Fortunately, they lacked the traction to make their claims go viral and only a small amount race relations was lost.

All colonies with a [abilityblue]Propagation Tower[/abilityblue] gain +{ProductionColony}[production/].[br/][br/]In addition, during combat on the domains of these colonies, all units gain +{MoraleAmount}[happiness/].[br/]All friendly Propagators cause this effect in battle while the operation is active.[br/][br/]While active, affected colonies [firecol]produce -{Energy}[energy/][/firecol] and the upkeep of Propagators is [firecol]increased by +{Upkeep}%[/firecol].
Propagation Tower is the Shakarn unique building. Propagator is a Shakarn Unit.
The Propagation Towers are now spreading motivational imagery.
When this unit enters combat, it grants +{Morale}[happiness/] to all friendly units.
All units of the owner of the broadcast gain {MoraleIncrease}[happiness/].
Attempt to spread false and disturbing propaganda on target enemy colony, causing {Unhappiness}[anger/] for {Duration}[turn/] as well as up to {RioterAmount}[rioter/].
We have successfully spread propaganda on the enemy colony that is so unsettling that it would make even a Kir'Ko blush!
Enemy counterintelligence stopped our agents from doing their work properly, though the attempt has left the colony in a state of civil unrest.
Someone spread distasteful propaganda through our colony, unsettling the local population.
An attempt was made to spread vile propaganda on our colony, but our counterintelligence team stopped them in time, though the attempt has left our colony in a state of civil unrest.

All colonies with a Propagation Tower gain +{OperationalDefense}[OperationDefense/][br/][br/]In addition, during combat on the domains of these colonies, all units gain +{ShieldGain}[shield/].[br/]All Propagators cause this effect in battle while the operation is active.[br/][br/]While active, affected colonies [firecol]produce -{Energy}[energy/][/firecol] and the upkeep of Propagators is [firecol]increased by +{Upkeep}%[/firecol]
Propagation Tower is the Shakarn unique building. Propagator is a Shakarn Unit.
The Propagation Towers are now spreading messages of vigilance and holoreal shields.
When this unit enters combat, it grants +{Shields}[shield/] to all friendly units.
All units of the owner of the broadcast gain {ShieldIncrease}[shield/].

All colonies with a Propagation Tower gain +{Happiness}[happiness/][br/][br/]In addition, at the start of each turn in combat on the domains of these colonies, all enemy non-Mindless units have a {HallucanationChance}[strengthPsyche/] chance of becoming [abilityred]Hallucinating[/abilityred] for {Duration}[turn/].[br/]All Propagators cause this effect in battle while the operation is active.[br/][br/]While active, affected colonies [firecol]produce -{Energy}[energy/][/firecol] and the upkeep of Propagators is [firecol]increased by +{Upkeep}%[/firecol]
Propagation Tower is the Shakarn unique building. Propagator is a Shakarn Unit.
The Propagation Towers are now spreading holoreal objects and entertainment to your citizens while confusing and befuddling enemies.
At the start of each comabt turn, non-Mindless enemy units have a {HallucinatingChance}[strengthPsyche/] chance to become [abilityred]Hallucinating[/abilityred] for {duration}[turn/].
At the start of each turn, non-Mindless enemy units have a {HallucinateChance}[strengthPsyche/] of becoming [abilityred]Hallucinating[/abilityred] for {Duration}[turn/].
All Infiltrator units you control gain +{Armor}[armor/] and {DamageIncrease}% damage increase, even when Holoshifted.[br/]Holoshift can now target Mechanical units.
Holoshift can now target Mechanical units.[br/]This unit gains +{Armor}[armor/] and deals +{DamageIncrease}% damage. This also applies when the unit is holoshifted.
All Infiltrator units you control gain +{Shield}[shield/] and {DamageIncrease}% damage increase, even when Holoshifted.
This unit gains +{Shield}[shield/] and deals +{DamageIncrease}% damage. This also applies when the unit is holoshifted.
Affects all friendly colonies with Propagation Towers
Propagation Tower is the Shakarn unique building.
This unit deals +{DamageIncrease}% damage. This also applies when the unit is holoshifted.
